comment: Perfect class for a Summer 4 week! So glad I got it over with. Exams are open book, and everything can be found online. There is a group tax research memo with 4-6 people, but that was easy.  You really don't need to come to class, just on the day you pick groups. The prof is pretty entertaining too, and she's really sweet. Such an easy A!

She is a very kind professor who genuinely wants her students to succeed. She will give out extra credit points if you attend certain classes. I will say that her lectures are confusing and I did not learn a lot from them. She went over some practice problems in class but was not the best at explaining their concepts. Kind of disorganized overall.

Confusing lectures sometimes, trips over words, makes obvious mistakes, but otherwise relatively kind and caring. Class was not very hard but sometimes left lectures more confused that I came in. Would recommend taking other professors for ACCT 3100 if possible, though she is not terrible.

Very sweet lady who cares if her students understand the topics discussed in class! Very respectful and was willing to stay after class to help me with a few homework problems. Shows diagrams when discussing hard topics to make it easy to understand. Tests were open-note and open-book online. I would highly recommend her for accounting 3200!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She was very nice and would help with any questions students had. Great professor, but the tests (150p each out of 1000) and final (300p out of 1000) seem to be too heavy in my opinion. However, I got a 70 and 75 on the first two tests and passed with an A so it is possible! She also offered 6 extra points on the final. Take her, she's really good.

Had synchronized lectures that she wouldn't record that were mainly her reading from the powerpoint or the hw answers. 2 group assignments that were semidifficult but not graded harshly. Allowed a few pages of handwritten notes for exams. Lots of numbers & %s that you have to learn or add to your notes. Hw is an easy boost. Seemed knowledgable.

Taking her class online was awful. Her lectures were extremely dry and did not explain anything beyond the basic concepts. She read directly from the Power Point and sped through it so fast you can't take good notes. I had to teach myself everything out of the textbook which is a LOT for a Federal Taxation class. She does offer extra credit.

She is tough but will help you out. Her tests were all tough but I managed to get a B in this class. If you are not an accounting major, I do not recommend taking this class. Get ready for lots of practice work!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Really nice lady, gives a ton of extra credit IF you go to class. The tests are made by the department and so they are different from her class and the lectures. We had 2 projects, both excel, pretty easy. Be ready to read the textbook to fully understand the material. This class was not her specialty and it showed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This class isn't that hard, just annoying if you don't care about accounting. This professor gives many chances for extra credit. My only problem is the Connect problems are not really good for studying for the exams. The way the questions are formated is not the same as the ones on the exam. She's very approachable.

Pretty good professor. Connect is streneous busy work that is over-complicated and long for no reason at all. Nothing on Connect helps on the exams, so just study her powerpoints and attend her lectures.

Top notch. She is funny and clearly enjoys teaching, which is represented by her high energy lectures. She does a good job explaining concepts that are sometimes a bit convoluted. She curved several of the exams and gave opportunities for extra credit. Attendance not mandatory but being there for the lectures makes all the difference.

Good teacher, connect quizzes are based on practice problems and book questions, I think she explains stuff really well but the class isn't an easy A. Do the learn smarts and practice problems and you'll do well on tests and quizzes. Overall a lot of work but its accounting so.... Would totally take her again.

Knows what she's talking about. Explains things clearly. Reads from slides a lot. Goes over problems in class. Vague exam reviews, closed book, so know your stuff. This class is no joke. Great professor overall. Would take her again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She is clear on work that needs to be done.  She reminds you on when quizzes (done at home) are due.  She wants you to learn and know it, since it is your major.  She cares and it shows.  She will answer any question day, night or weekend.  very responsive.  6 quizzes at home, 4 test.  she also help with getting a cheaper book.

The class was not easy. She expected a lot out of the class in the beginning, but became a little more laid back towards the end. Her lectures are based from the book so READ IT! Although she has experience in tax; she does not give you "real-world" examples. She teaches straight from the publisher's PPTs. Take the HW & quizzes seriously.
Test are open book but a bit challenging.  Take home is a bit challenging also.  Recommend that you prepare before the test.  Very clear on what she is teaching.
Attend class and you will survive. Exams are hard but doable if you attend the lectures . No partial credit on takehome exams
The material is hard but she explains it clearly.
Hard material. Prof breaks it down such that it is manageable.
This teacher is great- helpful and explains difficult material clearly. Yes, exams are difficult but similar to the homework and cover the areas she tell you to review.

THIS PROFESSOR IS NOT WORTH IT! She reads straight through slides that make very little sense and the material is difficult and she gives no further interpretation. She has 100+ slides per chapter. All tests were open book open note, but she makes them impossible. She does not prepare you for the CPA exam...she isn't one herself.

Very hard test questions.  Take-home tests are all essay.  No partial credit.  Majority of the class pulled a C.  Tech graduates were pulling Cs on tests as well.  Not recommended if you want a B or above.  Will not throw out a test questions if EVEN ONLY ONE person gets it right....
